pros: 5.5% 401k matching, above average health benefits, and flight benefits
cons:
Aside from the normal benefits that most Fortune 500 companies provide to employees, American is par for the course. The office culture is both sterile and static. Pay is below average compared to market for most positions. Flight benefits get worse every 6 months. Long, hard working hours are a badge of honor. Incredible lack of cultural diversity (especially in executive leadership). 

It seems as if every progressive trend we see in the work place that's being adopted, American remains stagnant or moves in the opposite direction. This applies to remote work policies, caring for employees, and technology investments.

pros:
American Airlines is doing all it can to help its employees stay employed during this pandemic. Reservations is one of the best places to work when it comes to avoiding being laid off. 
American has a great payscale and the ability to work and exchange hours as needed between co-workers. Plus we have a Union.
cons:
We have a union. So where individual exceptions could be made when it comes to things like attendance, or work/life balance, there is little to no consideration given for individual circumstances. 
Management is old! They need younger management from the CEO down so that we could truly work in this century. Plus the CEO is often talking smack about what departments he hopes to get rid of and why reservations is only an entry level position and not one for families to be raised on...even though many of his reservationist have over 10 years of experience.
And let’s not even talk about the inconsistencies given in punishments when it comes to race.
